required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Inguinal Hernia Repair and Male Fertility
clinical_study.official_title: Bilateral Inguinal Hernia Repair and Male Fertility: A Randomized Clinical Trial Comparing Lichtenstein Versus Laparoscopic Transabdominal Preperitoneal (TAPP) Technique

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

collaborator.agency: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: General objective: To evaluate the fertility of adult men submitted to bilateral herniorrhaphy with mesh placement by the Lichtenstein and laparoscopic approaches

detailed_description.textblock: Specific objectives: To correlate pre and postoperative data (90 and 180 days) of adult men, according to biochemistry parameters (hemogram and CRP), autoimmune (anti-sperm antibodies), hormonal (FSH, LH and testosterone), perfusion and volume testicular (USG of testicles with Doppler), spermogram, sexual changes, pain and quality of life (standard questionnaires).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized clinical trial with two groups, in according to hernioplasty correction approach
study_design_info.masking_description: Masking couldn't be possible because of the surgical technique

primary_outcome.description: Sperm Volume (in ml) measured by Semen analysis
Sperm concentration (million sperm/ml) measured by Semen analysis
Sperm number in million measured by Semen analysis
Sperm motility in % of progression measured by Semen analysis
Sperm morphology, according to the Kruger classification, evaluated by Semen analysis
Testicular volume, in cm3, measured by testicular ultrasound
Testicular vascularization, normal or not, measured by testicular Doppler ultrasound

secondary_outcome.description: Satisfied or not with sexual performance, Changes in arousal, Changes in libido and Changes in ejaculation or orgasm (Specific questionnaires)

SF36 Domains: Role physical, Physical function, Role emotional, Energy, Emotional health, Social functioning, Bodily pain and General health. Scale ranging from 0 to 100, where zero is the worst state and 100 is the best.
Visual Analog Scale (VAS) score ranging from 0 to 10, with 0 indicating no pain and 10 indicating the worst possible pain
Visual Analog Scale (VAS) score ranging from 0 to 10, with 0 indicating no pain and 10 indicating the worst possible pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male
- Age between 19 and 60 years old
- Bilateral inguinal hernia
- Primary and reducible inguinal hernia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age less than 19 or more than 60 years old
- ASA >III
- Genito-urinary infection
- Immunodeficiency
- History of testicular trauma2
- History of surgery or pelvic radiotherapy
- History of testicular disease
- Fertility problems or sexual
- Illness that can be infertile
- Recurrent hernia
- Unilateral hernia
- Femoral or inguine-scrotal hernia
- Imprisoned hernia
- Use of Gonadotrophins
- Use of anabolic steroids

facility.name: Hospital das Clínicas da Faculdade de Medicina da Universidade de São Paulo

patient_data.ipd_description: All individual participant data that underlie individual participant data that underlie collected during the trial, after deidentification (text, tables, figures, and appendices) will be shared. Study Protocol also will be available. Data will be available immediately following publication, no end dates, to anyone who wishes to access the data, for any types of analyses. Proposals should be directed to sergio.damous@hc.fm.usp.br
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available immediately following publication, no end dates.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Proposals should be directed to sergio.damous@hc.fm.usp.br
